questions.question: Which of the following statements regarding rodenticide toxicity in dogs is CORRECT?
options: Activated partial thromboplastin time (APTT) becomes prolonged before prothrombin time (PT)
Anticoagulant rodenticides inhibit the recycling of Vitamin K from Vitamin K epoxide
Anticoagulant rodenticides result in reduced activity of clotting factors II, VII, IX and XI
Vitamin K1 should be administered intravenously

questions.question: Which one of the following statements about vasopressin (ADH or AVP) is CORRECT?
options: ADH and oxytocin are peptides of similar structures
ADH reduces the permeability of the collecting ducts to urea
Glucocorticoids stimulate release of ADH, leading to thirst, but inhibit the action of ADH, leading to polyuria
In the presence of ADH, the osmolarity of the tubular fluid within the distal and collecting tubules is lower compared to the osmolarity in the Bowman's space

questions.question: Which one of the following statements regarding bilirubin measurement is CORRECT?
options: Bilirubin measurement is unaffected by the presence of lipemia
High bilirubin can be present in septic patients
High bilirubin is a common finding in patients with a congenital porto-systemic liver shunt
In hemolytic anemia, unconjugated bilirubin is usually high and conjugated bilirubin is usually normal

questions.question: Which one of the following statements about serologic testing for heartworm disease (Dirofilariasis) is WRONG?
options: Antibody testing is the test of choice for diagnosing heartworm disease in cats
Antigen testing is more sensitive than microfilarial concentration tests in dogs
Circulating antigen is generally undetectable until 6 to 7 months following infection in dogs
In dogs, a positive antigen test 12 weeks after treatment with adulticide is indicative of treatment failure

questions.question: Which systemic abnormality can cause atrial fibrillation?
options: Digoxin toxicity
Hypokalaemia
Hypothyroidism
Severe anaemia

questions.question: Which one of the following statements regarding gene therapy is the MOST ACCURATE?
options: Inappropriate inflammatory responses to gene therapy are very uncommon
Non-viral vectors are used in most gene therapy trials
Systemic delivery of viral vectors is impeded by clearance by the immune system
Treatment of infectious disorders is a main target for gene therapy

questions.question: Which of the following statements about aminoglycoside antibiotics is CORRECT?
options: Aminoglycosides accumulate in proximal renal tubular cells
Aminoglycosides accumulate in the mesangial cells of the renal glomerulus
Aminoglycosides have good activity against anaerobic bacteria
Aminoglycosides interfere with the synthesis of the bacterial cell wall

questions.question: What is the CORRECT definition for Multiple Organ Dysfunction Syndrome (MODS)?
options: A clinical syndrome caused by systemic inflammation of infectious or non-infectious origin
Altered function of two or more organs secondary to the Systemic Inflammatory Response Syndrome such that homeostasis cannot be maintained without intervention
The systemic inflammatory response to bacteremia associated with organ dysfunction and manifestations of hypoperfusion or hypotension
The systemic inflammatory response to infection with hypotension, despite adequate fluid resuscitation along with the manifestations of hypoperfusion

questions.question: Which one of the following statements regarding leptospirosis is CORRECT?
options: Because they have a natural resistance to infection, cats do not develop leptospiremia or leptospiruria
Microscopic agglutination test (MAT) titers are usually positive within the first 3 days following infection
Soon after beginning doxycycline therapy most dogs stop shedding leptospires in the urine
Vaccinated dogs with low MAT titers against the vaccine serovars remain susceptible to the other serovars

questions.question: What causes a left‐shift of the oxygen‐hemoglobin dissociation curve?
options: Decrease in blood hydrogen ion concentrations (i.e. increased blood pH, alkalemia)
Exercise
Increase in the concentration of 2,3‐DPG
Rise of pCO2
